column4: UPDATE 2-"Call of Duty" sets another first-day record
column5: Nov 11 Activision Blizzard's "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3" racked up more than $400 million in sales on its first day in stores in North America and the United Kingdom  setting a video game industry record.

column4: Call of Duty has $400 million in sales on day 1
column5: Activision Blizzard's "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3" video game racked up more than $400 million in sales on its first day in stores in the United States and the United Kingdom.

column4: Adobe throws in towel to Apple in Web software war
column5: NEW YORK Adobe Systems Inc halted development of its Flash Player for mobile browsers  surrendering to Apple Inc in a war over Web standards as the company surprised investors with a restructuring plan.

column4: Apple releases iPhone battery drain software fix
column5: Apple Inc on Thursday released a software update for its iOS 5 operating system to fix complaints on the performance of the new iPhone 4S battery. | Video

column4: Text-Fitch affirms Comcast NBCUniversal IDRs
column5: CHICAGO  November 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the 'BBB+' Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) assigned to Comcast Corporation (Comcast) and its wholly owned subsidiaries included in Comcast's cross-guaranty structure that hold all of the company's cable businesses.     Fitch has also affirmed the 'BBB' IDR assigned to NBCUniversal Media  LLC (NBCUniversal)  a direct wholly owned subsidiary of NBCUniversal  LLC. NBCUniversal  LLC is a joint venture between Comcast and General Electric Company (

column4: Discovery COO Ligouri to leave by year-end
column5: NEW YORK Peter Ligouri  the executive charged with setting up Discovery Communications' joint venture networks is stepping down after two years in his role as chief operating officer by end of the year.

column4: Peter Liguori out at OWN  Discovery
column5: LOS ANGELES (TheWrap.com) - Four months after Oprah Winfrey seized the reins to Discovery Communications' most glamorous asset  the Oprah Winfrey Network  Peter Liguori announced Wednesday that he is leaving his post as Discovery's COO at the end of the year.

column4: EMI sale ends 80 years of independence
column5: NEW YORK EMI  the London-based record label that for 80 years brought the world everyone from the Beatles and Queen to Coldplay and Katy Perry  is no longer independent.

column4: Vivendi to raise its dividend: CEO
column5: PARIS France's Vivendi will raise its dividend even as it acquires EMI's recorded music division  Vivendi's chief executive told a conference call on Friday.

column4: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions
column5: Nov 11 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals involving European  U.S. and Asian companies were reported by 2100 GMT on Friday:

column4: Vivendi to raise its dividend -CEO
column5: PARIS  Nov 11 France's Vivendi  will raise its dividend even as it acquires EMI's recorded music division  Vivendi's chief executive told a conference call on Friday.

column4: Vivendi to boost earnings with EMI deal -CEO
column5: PARIS  Nov 11 Vivendi will see earnings boosted as early as "year one" of its acquisition of EMI's recorded music division from U.S. bank Citigroup  Vivendi's chief executive said on Friday.

column4: Universal back in talks to buy EMI labels: sources
column5: NEW YORK The world's largest music company  Universal Music  is back in talks to buy EMI's labels  according to sources  raising the specter of an anti-trust battle after a music trade body said it asked regulators to block the bid.

column4: Vivendi's Universal unit closing on EMI bid - report
column5: PARIS  Nov 11 Vivendi's Universal Music unit is closing in on a $1.9 billion deal to buy EMI's recorded music business  which could be announced early next week  the Financial Times reported on Friday  citing people familiar with the talks.

column4: Starbucks to open U.S. juice bars in 2012
column5: Starbucks Corp  plans to start a chain of juice bars starting next year  venturing into territory staked out by Jamba Inc   in its biggest-ever expansion beyond coffee.

column4: UPDATE 1-KKR  TPG mull minority stakes in Yahoo -- sources
column5: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO  Nov 11 Private equity firms  including KKR and Co LP and TPG Capital LP  are looking to potentially buy minority stakes of up to 20 percent in Yahoo Inc with an eye to eventually taking over the whole company  people with knowledge of the situation said.

column4: BSkyB board unanimous in support of James Murdoch
column5: LONDON BSkyB's independent directors unanimously backed James Murdoch as chairman on Friday in a letter addressing shareholders' concerns about his suitability following the phone-hacking scandal at the News of the World.

column4: UPDATE 1-BSkyB board unanimous in support of James Murdoch
column5: LONDON  Nov 11 BSkyB's independent directors unanimously backed James Murdoch as chairman on Friday in a letter addressing shareholders' concerns about his suitability following the phone-hacking scandal at the News of the World.

column4: UK activists say BSkyB investors should oust Murdoch
column5: LONDON  Nov 11 An investor activist group said BSkyB shareholders should oppose the re-election of chairman James Murdoch to distance the pay-TV company from the hacking scandal that has engulfed News Corp  its largest shareholder.

column4: BSkyB board unanimous in support of James Murdoch
column5: LONDON BSkyB's independent directors unanimously backed James Murdoch as chairman on Friday in a letter addressing shareholders' concerns about his suitability following the phone-hacking scandal at the News of the World.

column4: Chipmaker Nvidia's quarterly results beats Street
column5: Nvidia Corp's third-quarter results beat estimates as the chipmaker refocused on smartphones and tablets in a tepid personal computer market  although its revenue forecast was a bit lower than expected.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures advance ahead of Italy austerity vote
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 11 U.S. stock index futures rose on Friday with markets hopeful that debt-laden Italy will implement tough austerity measures crucial to avoid a euro zone meltdown.

column4: Starbucks to open U.S. juice bars in 2012
column5: Starbucks Corp  plans to start a chain of juice bars starting next year  venturing into territory staked out by Jamba Inc   in its biggest-ever expansion beyond coffee.

column4: UPDATE 2-Strayer to buy Jack Welch's business college
column5: Nov 11 Strayer University is buying the business management college founded by the legendary former chief executive of General Electric  Jack Welch  to expand its bouquet of MBA programs.

column4: UPDATE 1-Fitch cuts Hungary's outlook to negative
column5: * Says weaker growth  fiscal pressures could lead to downgrade

column4: Fitch cuts Hungary's outlook to negative
column5: BUDAPEST  Nov 11 Rating agency Fitch has revised the outlook on Hungary's long-term foreign and local currency issuer ratings to "negative" from "stable" and affirmed the ratings at 'BBB-' and 'BBB'  respectively  it said on Friday.

column4: Analysis: H&R Block ruling bodes ill for AT&T
column5: WASHINGTON The rejection of tax preparer H&R Block Inc's  planned acquisition of rival TaxACT bodes ill for AT&T Inc  as it attempts to buy T-Mobile USA  antitrust experts said.

column4: AT&T  U.S. argue over witnesses in antitrust trial
column5: WASHINGTON AT&T Inc complained on Wednesday that the Justice Department was too slow in telling who its witnesses would be as the government seeks to block the telecommunications giant's acquisition of rival T-Mobile USA.

column4: AIRSHOW-Gulf expansion to roll on despite European turbulence
column5: Dubai  Nov 11 Gulf airlines and lessors could splash out more than $20 billion on Airbus and Boeing jets at next week's Dubai air show  underscoring the region's role as the industry's chief paymaster amid Europe's worsening sovereign debt crisis.

column4: REFILE-AIRSHOW-Qatar Airways  Emirates set for big orders-sources
column5: Nov 11 Qatar Airways  Dubai's Emirates  and Kuwaiti lessor Alafco could place hefty aircraft orders at the Dubai Airshow starting on Sunday  industry sources said.

column4: U.S. may sell precision-guided bombs to UAE-source
column5: WASHINGTON  Nov 12 The U.S. government may soon announce plans for a large sale of precision-guided bombs to the United Arab Emirates  a source familiar with the arms sales plans said late on Thursday  as tensions mounted with Iran over its nuclear program.

column4: BP Carson refinery restarting unit after maintenance
column5: HOUSTON  Nov 11 BP Plc's  253 000 barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery in Carson  California  was restarting a unit after planned maintenance at the refinery  according to a notice the refinery filed on Friday with California state pollution regulators.

column4: Russian court rejects $13 billion lawsuit against BP
column5: MOSCOW A Russian court on Friday rejected a $13 billion lawsuit  filed by TNK-BP minority shareholders against BP  a BP lawyer told Reuters.

column4: Russian court rejects $13 bln lawsuit against BP
column5: MOSCOW  Nov 11 A Russian court on Friday rejected a $13 billion lawsuit  filed by TNK-BP  minority shareholders against BP  a BP lawyer told Reuters.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX may open higher on euro zone hopes
column5: Nov 11 Toronto's main stock index looked set to edge higher at the open on Friday  with markets hopeful that debt-laden Italy will implement tough austerity measures crucial to avoid a euro zone meltdown.
